conclusion: Analyze the paths the streams from A, B, and C will take as they pass through the baffles.
Stream A starts from the top left.
The first baffle Stream A encounters is light blue and angled downward to the right.
The liquid from Stream A will flow down and to the right, passing over other bars.
Stream A will likely flow into the second container from the left (white).
Stream B starts from the top center.
The first baffle Stream B encounters is black, angled downward to the left.
The liquid from Stream B will flow down and to the left.
Stream B will likely flow into the first container from the left (orange).
Stream C starts from the top right.
The first baffle Stream C encounters is green, angled downward to the right.
The liquid from Stream C will flow down and to the right.
Stream C will likely flow into the last container on the right (black).
A flows into the white container.
B flows into the orange container.
C flows into the black container.
The containers that will collect the liquid are D (orange) and E (black), with the majority likely going into E due to the path of C.
